parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To urge, press, constrain by entreaties. From para and the middle voice of biazo; to force contrary to, i.e. Compel.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Evening. Feminine of an adjective hesperos; the eve.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to slant or slope, i.e. Incline or recline.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
